cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles south of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north across the Yucatán Channel, then turning north-northeast across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward Florida’s Big Bend coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key to Aucilla River area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Englewood to Indian Pass, FL including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for Tampa Bay at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast from Chokoloskee northward to Indian Pass, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (85% cumulative) of tropical-storm-force winds, with a 50% chance of 50-kt winds and about 25% chance of hurricane-force (64-kt) winds as the core passes north of Tampa Bay on Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC storm-surge watch indicates 4–7 ft of inundation possible in Tampa Bay if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast 4–8 inches with locally higher amounts, producing flash and urban flooding potential around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous marine conditions, large waves in the bay, life-threatening rip currents, and the risk of a few tornadoes in outer rain-bands.
